meanings.definition: Make the sound and movement of vomiting.
meanings.sent1: The sight of the spoiled milk made him retch uncontrollably.
meanings.sent2: She retched loudly after eating the expired seafood.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that the terrible singing made him retch in his seat.
meanings.sent4: The smell of the garbage can made her retch as if she had actually eaten it.
meanings.sent5: The graphic description of the illness made the audience retch in disgust.

meanings.sent1: The strong smell of the fish made him retch involuntarily.
meanings.sent2: She retched at the thought of having to clean up the mess.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist in the movie made her retch with surprise.
meanings.sent4: The intense fear of heights made him retch as if he were about to fall.
meanings.sent5: The bitter taste of the medicine made the child retch in protest.
